newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila says hosting defector to keep peace in Asia.
newsitem.headline: Manila says hosting defector to keep peace in Asia.

text.p: The Philippines' hosting of North Korean defector Hwang Jang-yop will enhance peace and stability in the east Asian region, Philippine President Fidel Ramos said on Saturday.
"By doing this, we enhance not only the chances of reconciliation of the two Koreas but also enhance the peace and security of the Asia Pacific region," Ramos said at a news conference.

Ramos said the Philippines would not only earn goodwill from South Korea by hosting the defector but also from China, caught in a diplomatic dilemma after Hwang, the highest-ranking ideologue in North Korea, walked into the South Korean consulate in Beijing last February and sought asylum.
China was unable to send Hwang directly to Seoul without incurring the ire of its long-time ally, Pyongyang.
In early March, the Philippines offered to be the transit point between Beijing and Seoul for Hwang.
"I understand from the diplomatic feedback that...(it) is also seen favourably by China," Ramos said.
The Philippines and China have been locked in a diplomatic impasse over mutual claims to a group of islets and reefs in the South China Sea.
Hwang, who slipped into the Philippines last month, has not been seen by reporters. He is reported to be staying in the country until the middle of the month.
Ramos was speaking in Cebu, where a meeting of finance ministers from the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum was taking place.
